# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line_length = 0
    lines = []

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, '\n')
            line_length = 0
        elseif line_length > 0
            push!(lines, ' ')
            line_length += 1
        end

        push!(lines, word)
        line_length += length(word)
    end

    return join(lines)
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Upon calling `wrap_string` with the example text, the output will be:

```
The quick
brown fox
jumps over
the lazy
dog
```
